title: E-commerce Security & Anti-Phishing

sections.title: E-commerce & Security Vocabulary
sections.content:
Shopping online requires advanced security layers to protect your financial data from cybercriminals.

- **Virtual Card**: A digital-only card generated in your app for one-time or specific online use to hide your main card details.
- **3D Secure**: An additional security layer for online credit and debit card transactions (e.g., Verified by Visa).
- **OTP (One-Time Password)**: A unique code sent to your phone to authorize a specific transaction.
- **Social Engineering**: The psychological manipulation of people into performing actions or divulging confidential information.
- **Phishing**: A fraudulent attempt to obtain sensitive information such as usernames and passwords by disguising as a trustworthy entity.
- **HTTPS / Padlock**: Indicators that a website uses encryption to secure the connection.
- **Checkout**: The final step of an online transaction where the payment is processed.

sections.title: 3D Secure Payment Flow
sections.content:
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Enter Card Details] --> B[Merchant Request]
    B --> C{3D Secure Trigger}
    C -- Send OTP --> D[Customer Phone]
    D -- Enter Code --> E[Verification]
    E -- Success --> F[Bank Approves]
    F --> G[Order Confirmed]
    E -- Fail --> H[Transaction Declined]
```

sections.title: Present Continuous for the Future: Fixed Arrangements
sections.content:
We use the **Present Continuous** (am/is/are + verb-ing) to talk about fixed future plans and arrangements that are already organized.

**Usage in Fintech:**
- *I **am meeting** the security consultant at 10 AM tomorrow.* (The meeting is scheduled).
- *We **are launching** the new virtual card feature next Monday.* (The date is set).
- *They **are attending** a cybersecurity webinar this evening.*
- *I **am not working** on the fraud report this weekend.*

**Difference from 'going to':**
- **Going to**: Intentions or general plans. (*I'm going to buy a new laptop eventually*).
- **Present Continuous**: Specific arrangements with a time and place. (*I'm buying the laptop tomorrow at the Apple Store*).

objectives: Safely navigate e-commerce checkouts and secure websites
Utilize virtual cards and 3D Secure for online payments
Use the Present Continuous to describe scheduled future events
